channel.title: [SOLVED] Inconsistency in GPG key howto?
channel.description:
Now that a new version of Whonix is out, this is probably actual. https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Whonix_Signing_Key It says:
2. Store it as adrelanos.asc.
but then
3. Import the key: gpg --import patrick.asc
Did it happen because the second occurence of "adrelanos" wasn't replaced by mistake as well, now that the main Whonix developer decided to go open about his identity? Of course the filename is just a placeholder, but this inconsistence can confuse less experienced users who are making their first steps with GPG and are just following the howto step by step.

item.title: [SOLVED] Inconsistency in GPG key howto?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Sure, should be corrected. Fixed the inconsistent naming.

Yes happened because of this. (giving up pseudonymity after collecting experiences with pseudonymous project development)

Read full topic

item.title: [SOLVED] Inconsistency in GPG key howto?
item.dc:creator: Greenwhonix
item.description:
Now that a new version of Whonix is out, this is probably actual.

Whonix – 3 May 20

Download the Whonix ™ Signing Key

Get Whonix ™ OpenPGP signing key. Verify Whonix ™ Downloads and/or Source Code.

It says:

2. Store it as adrelanos.asc.

but then

3. Import the key:

gpg --import patrick.asc

Did it happen because the second occurence of “adrelanos” wasn’t replaced by mistake as well, now that the main Whonix developer decided to go open about his identity?

Of course the filename is just a placeholder, but this inconsistence can confuse less experienced users who are making their first steps with GPG and are just following the howto step by step.

Read full topic
